unnormalised: Okay, folks, buckle up! It's been a crazy month for car launches here in India. The automotive scene is hotter than a Mumbai summer, and my wallet is already crying!
normalised: Okay, folks, buckle up! It has been a crazy month for car launches here in India. The automotive scene is hotter than a Mumbai summer, and my wallet is already crying!

unnormalised: First up, we had the much-awaited launch of the "Bijlee Bolt" from a new EV startup based out of Chennai. Apparently, some IIT Madras grads are behind it, so you know it's gotta be packing some serious tech. They're promising a range of around 400 km on a single charge. Price point is somewhere around Rs. 15 Lakhs, which seems pretty competitive.
normalised: First up, we had the much awaited launch of the "Bijlee Bolt" from a new E V startup based out of Chennai. Apparently, some I I T Madras grads are behind it, so you know it has got to be packing some serious tech. They are promising a range of around four hundred kilometer on a single charge. Price point is somewhere around rupee fifteen lakhs, which seems pretty competitive.

unnormalised: Then, Maruti Suzuki finally unveiled the next-gen "Swiftiago". It's supposedly got some snazzy new features and a fuel efficiency that'll make your petrol pump visits feel like a distant dream. Heard rumors of a mileage of 28 kmpl. Remember the "Golmaal" movie car chase? This new Swiftiago would totally nail that scene, minus the chaos, of course!
normalised: Then, Maruti Suzuki finally unveiled the next-gen "Swiftiago". It is supposedly got some snazzy new features and a fuel efficiency that will make your petrol pump visits feel like a distant dream. Heard rumors of a mileage of twenty eight kilometer per liter. Remember the "Golmaal" movie car chase? This new Swiftiago would totally nail that scene, minus the chaos, of course!

unnormalised: Mahindra is also jumping into the fray with a rugged SUV called the "Tharunator". Designed for those weekend getaways to Ladakh or maybe even just surviving the Bangalore traffic, this beast looks ready for anything. Expect a price tag upwards of Rs. 20 Lakhs.
normalised: Mahindra is also jumping into the fray with a rugged S U V called the "Tharunator". Designed for those weekend getaways to Ladakh or maybe even just surviving the Bangalore traffic, this beast looks ready for anything. Expect a price tag upwards of rupee twenty lakhs.

unnormalised: And let's not forget the luxury segment! Mercedes-Benz dropped their new S-Class in Delhi, with enough tech to rival ISRO. But, let's be real, who's got the crores to spare? (Certainly not this blogger!).
normalised: And let us not forget the luxury segment! Mercedes-Benz dropped their new S-Class in Delhi, with enough tech to rival I S R O. But, let us be real, who has got the crores to spare? (Certainly not this blogger!).

unnormalised: So, there you have it – a whirlwind tour of the latest vehicle launches in India. Which one are you eyeing? Let me know in the comments! My personal pick? Still saving up for that Bijlee Bolt. The future is electric, yaar!
normalised: So, there you have it – a whirlwind tour of the latest vehicle launches in India. Which one are you eyeing? Let me know in the comments! My personal pick? Still saving up for that Bijlee Bolt. The future is electric, yaar!
